item.title: Professional General Body Meeting with Anne Ryan to be Held October 17
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 17, 2024 5:30 PM - 6:45 PM - Join the Society of Women Engineers for its rescheduled resume workshop hosted by decorated conference speaker and RPI alum Anne Ryan! She will be joining us online, and participants can attend either in the Shelnutt Gallery (room 3606) in the Rensselaer Union or via Webex!
item.author: Students

item.title: Enjoy a Full Moon Night Hike at Grafton State Park!
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 17, 2024 7:00 PM - 11:00 PM - Celebrate Outdoor Week by taking part in this nighttime hike at Grafton State Park to see the full moon! Hikers will meet in the RPI Union Horseshoe; please contact Will Weinert if you have any questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: First of Economics Virtual Info Sessions to be Held October 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Attend this information session to learn about the PhD and MS programs in Economics. As a bonus, attendees will receive a $75 waiver toward the application fee! Please register to receive the meeting link.

item.title: DotCIO Posts Reminder Regarding Compliance with Campus Email Policy
item.description: Members of DotCIO’s IT Security team wish to remind all members of the Rensselaer community that Institute policy states that email accounts obtained through third parties may not be used in conducting the business of the Institute, and that ensuring compliance with the Rensselaer email policy is crucial.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Host Virtual MBA for Professionals Review
item.description: Date: Friday, October 18, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Monthly Meeting Scheduled for October 16
item.description: Join students and colleagues interested in quantum computing or those currently working on the subject at noon on Wednesday, October 16 in Amos Eaton 214. If you are interested in presenting, please contact Tom Morgan.
item.author: Community

item.title: “The Other Side of Silence” Coming to EMPAC
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 7:00 PM - “The Other Side of Silence” examines technology’s role in the fabric of human society and the role it plays in promoting and diminishing our autonomy, as seen through the lens of an augmentative and alternative communication user – someone who uses a synthetic voice to communicate with the world. Through a series of interwoven storylines, this new opera explores what it means to be our true self, and which of our voices best represents our identity.
item.author: Community

item.title: Order of the Engineer Induction Ceremony Scheduled for October 30
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Initiated in the United States to foster a spirit of pride and responsibility in the engineering profession, the Order of the Engineer will be inducting senior and graduate engineering students at this year’s ceremony, with initiates receiving a stainless steel ring to remind them to make ethical decisions throughout their engineering careers. Come and show your support for these new inductees!
item.author: Community

item.title: EHS Shares Fire Safety Tips and Offers Fire Extinguisher Training
item.description: In support of National Fire Protection Association’s (NFPA) 2024 Fire Prevention Week, Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) has gathered key safety reminders about smoke detectors. EHS will also be offering hands-on fire extinguisher training at 41 Ninth Street on October 23, October 29 and November 12, so be sure to sign up in advance in Percipio!
item.author: Community

item.title: Middle States Commission on Higher Education Preliminary Visit Scheduled for October 17
item.description: Date: Thursday, October 17, 2024 - As part of the MSCHE self-study, Dr. Teik C. Lim, President of NJIT, and Dr. Deess, Executive Director of Institutional Effectiveness, will meet with Rensselaer’s Board of Trustees, senior leadership, faculty, staff, and students. The staff session begins at 1:15PM, and the faculty session at 2:00PM; participation is encouraged! Refer to the call for participation for more information.

item.title: “Tips for Planning Your Condensed Course” to be Topic of Fac/Staff Quick Learn Webinar
item.description:
Date: Monday, October 28, 2024 11:00 AM - 11:30 AM - Meant to assist instructors who are teaching in The Arch or short semester courses in planning and presenting their course material in innovative, effective, and carefully considered ways, this webinar will offer quick tips on best practices in condensing coursework. Please register if you plan to attend.
